alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Henderson; McDonough; Warren (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 8:55PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Hancock, southern Henderson, Warren, northern McDonough, southeastern Des Moines and eastern Lee Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 854 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Carman to 6 miles southeast of Burnside. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Stronghurst around 900 PM CDT. Blandinsville and Raritan around 905 PM CDT. Sciota around 910 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Macomb, Roseville, Kirkwood, Good Hope, Bushnell, Little Swan Lake and Prairie City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
